"Scholarly" and "Turnbull" in the same sentence? Egads! It is a sad, 
sad day...

--- In samuraihistory@y..., fifthchamber@a... wrote:
> Hi there.
>  The closest 'scholarly' book in English is by Stephen Turnbull-
 "Ninja", a 
> good book overall and packed with translations from historical 
books and 
> scrolls that depict the images of the Shinobi as they were seen 
throughout 
> the Samurai years in Japan.
>  As far as Japanese books go try 'Shoninki', 'Bansenshukai', 
or 'Ninpiden' 
> for writings from the source as it were and the various books by 
Masaaki 
> Hatsumi are also worth the read.
>  HTH.
>  Abayo.
>  (Also try this site... www.ninpo.org )
